name: Cloud
description: The Cloud object describes a cloud service or resource. It refers to compute, storage, networking, security, or other services that are accessed over the internet, which are hosted at a remote data center and managed by a cloud services provider.

name.description: The name of the service or resource. For example, the Object Storage container or bucket name.

type.description: The type of the cloud service or resource. For example: Object Storage.

org_unit.description: The name of an organizational unit that uses the Cloud resource or service.

provider.description: The unique name of the Cloud services provider, such as AWS, MS Azure, GCP, etc.

region.description: The name of the cloud region, as defined by the cloud provider. The region identifies a physical location around the world where the cloud data centers are located. The region has a set of one or more data centers, which are deployed within a latency-defined perimeter and connected through a dedicated regional low-latency network.

zone.name: Zone
zone.description: The Zone or availability zone refers to an isolated data center within a single region. The Zone has one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity in a single region.
